result.execSummary:
The defendant TERRILL R SCHWARTZ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: BOND APPLIED.  Outstanding financial obligations are to be paid directly to the Winnebago County Clerk of Courts within 60 days.  Payment plans are available in the Clerk of Courts office.  Send payments to:  Clerk of Courts, Room 110, 415 Jackson Street, P O Box 2808, Oshkosh WI  54903-2808 Do NOT pay Probation Agent. Debts older than 90 days will be processed for civil judgment and sent to the Department of Revenue for collection including tax intercept. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup. Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision. Defendant shall pay court appointed attorney fees.   

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  *** DUE TO COVID-19 PANDEMIC CALL 920-236-4906 BEFORE REPORTING TO THE COURTHOUSE.  HAVE YOUR COURT PAPERWORK IN HAND WHEN YOU MAKE THE CALL.  STAFF WILL GIVE YOU FURTHER DIRECTIONS.***Immediately following court, please report to:  Room 15 on the lower level of the Courthouse, 415 Jackson Street Oshkosh WI.  Collections are done Monday - Friday 8:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.  You have 72 hours to make arrangements to complete collection.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

2ND DEG. SEX. ASSAULT/UNCONSCIOUS VICTIM
CONDITIONS:  No contact with V1 in Menasha PD report #21-814.  Absolute sobriety.  No alcohol consumption or possession.  Comply with the Alcohol 24/7 Program. Defendant shall contact (920)232-1919 IMMEDIATELY after their court hearing to schedule an appointment to be set up on the program.  If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.  The defendant shall bring the Alcohol Monitoring Device to every hearing.  No contact with the 1000 block of Lucerne Dr. Menasha.  Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are.  May pick up belongings one time accompanied by police escort once 72 hour no contact is no longer in effect, provided there are no other court orders prohibiting contact.
